patch 8.2.0445: png and xpm files not in MS-Windows zip file

Problem:    Png and xpm files not in MS-Windows zip file.
Solution:   Move files to shared between Unix and Windows target.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/bfcfd5784a2fe950d8e58d1d534bbbb4824524eb|patch 8.2.0447: terminal scroll tests fails on some systems>
patch 8.2.0447: terminal scroll tests fails on some systems

Problem:    Terminal scroll tests fails on some systems.
Solution:   Remove the fixed 100msec wait for Win32.  Add a loop to wait until
            scrolling has finished. (James McCoy, closes #5842)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0447: terminal scroll tests fails on some systems · vim/vim@bfcfd57
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0447: terminal scroll tests fails on some systems · vim/vim@bfcfd57
attachments.text: Problem: Terminal scroll tests fails on some systems. Solution: Remove the fixed 100msec wait for Win32. Add a loop to wait until scrolling has finished. (James McCoy, closes #5842)

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/cf3f8bf4ddfbc0f5ce53f0c9270dc15567f4feea|patch 8.2.0449: Vim9: crash if return type is invalid>
patch 8.2.0449: Vim9: crash if return type is invalid

Problem:    Vim9: crash if return type is invalid. (Yegappan Lakshmanan)
Solution:   Always return some type, not NULL.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0449: Vim9: crash if return type is invalid · vim/vim@cf3f8bf
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0449: Vim9: crash if return type is invalid · vim/vim@cf3f8bf
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: crash if return type is invalid. (Yegappan Lakshmanan) Solution: Always return some type, not NULL.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/82e743c5b343847d88b958594ad3433213ef9405|patch 8.2.0451: Win32: double-width character displayed incorrectly>
patch 8.2.0451: Win32: double-width character displayed incorrectly

Problem:    Win32: double-width character displayed incorrectly.
Solution:   First move the cursor to the first column. (Nobuhiro Takasaki,
            closes #5848)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0451: Win32: double-width character displayed incorrectly · vim/vim@82e743c
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0451: Win32: double-width character displayed incorrectly · vim/vim@82e743c
attachments.text: Problem: Win32: double-width character displayed incorrectly. Solution: First move the cursor to the first column. (Nobuhiro Takasaki, closes #5848)
